website_summaries.verdict: A snug-fitting yet comfortable hydration waistpack, though owners of larger phones may be frustrated trying to cram them into the slim pocket.
pros: Carries smartphone and other small items snugly
Does not bounce at all when running, even when water bottles are full
cons: Large-format phones, particularly those in cases, will not fit the main pocket well
Fabric can chafe bare skin during a run

website_summaries.verdict: This helpful product offers adequate storage alongside 2 water bottles for long-distance runs.
pros: Material is waterproof and tear resistant
Front pocket includes top zipper for protection and headphone hole
cons: A few customers had problems with the belt riding up during their runs

website_summaries.verdict: Those wanting a running belt that holds water will find their match in this remarkably efficient product.
pros: Adjustable waist strap can double as a shoulder strap
Pocket can hold phones of many sizes
cons: Tightening the belt is problematic for some

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about getting a running belt w/ the water bottles but needed something for my long training runs and don't like to have anything in my hands. It's comfortable and doesn't feel heavy around my waist. If you wear it w/ the water bottles in the front then it doesn't shift during the run. If you try to wear it w/ the water bottles in the back then it shifts too much. The zipper pocket is great too for a key and ipod.
customer_reviews.author: DocJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Long Races 😊
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these 2 running belts for the Howl at The Moon 10 mile race in Clermont Florida for my son and myself. They were perfect. They weren't too heavy, which for 2 people who normally do not run with water bottles, was a genuine concern of mine. I had plenty of room for my phone, 2 cliff gel packs, an ibuprofen, and my ID (just in case I had a medical emergency while in route) as the race didn't start until 8:15pm. They are well made and the price is completely affordable. Should I ever need another water bottle holding running belt I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Lynn Fine

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Care!
customer_reviews.text: My original review was not favorable. But subsequently the suppliers offered a free re-designed version that solved my problem with the difficulty of replacing the emptied bottle back in the pouch while running. The new version solved the problem and I am pleased to give it a five star rating. Rare to have a supplier to such lengths to keep a customer happy. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: William Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this belt, it holds my iPhone X, car keys, credit cards. The 2 water bottle didn’t bother me at all, very lightweight, didn’t get on my way. I tried it on 5k run :). It does move a little bit, even though you put it on the back or front, but it’s not to the point that it gets on the way. I am very short and petite, so I have to cut the strap cause it’s too long, other than that it works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Carmela Dye

customer_reviews.title: Training for a 1/2
customer_reviews.text: I finally decided that I needed to bring water with me when I ran. it would get so hot. I used to not drink water during and just drink some after a run. but it is so nice to have water when you need it. I like this fanny pack too. the straps hang out on the side, but if you're running you won't even notice. I only notice it when I'm walking and my hand hits it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Martin

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have three different types of running belts, all serve a different purpose, however, this one is most comfortable by far. It has a padded surface at the back of the bag. As it relates to reports about the belt being too long, all I did is adjust mine that it fit me comfortable and had a little room for adjustment and I cut the ends. To prevent the cut ends from frailing, I burnt both of them.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great deal 😎
customer_reviews.text: I looked at several similar running belts before deciding on this one. First off, I liked the the 6 oz. size bottles over the 10, which seemed too bulky (I use my CamelBak for long distances or hot days). Also, the zipper to the pocket was near the top rather than more in the middle like most other ones were. Good design. My phone fits perfect, measures 6 in. by 3 in., with room for my keys and not much else. Price was great. Very happy with this belt!
customer_reviews.author: Rockin' Robin

customer_reviews.title: Nice if your waist is more than 34 1/2”
customer_reviews.text: I’m an athletic woman US pant size 4 (27” waist). This belt is comically huge, even when made as small as possible. The smallest it can adjust to is 34 1/2”. Otherwise, it seems like a real quality belt. It even fits my iPhone 6 that is housed in a heavy duty case. If it had fit me, the belt would’ve gotten 5 stars, but a “one size fits all” running belt that doesn’t fit an average-sized female athlete, needs to be knocked down a few pegs.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah S.

customer_reviews.title: Large front pocket, but rode up on stomach
customer_reviews.text: Decent running belt, the pocket is large enough for my Google Pixel, a granola bar, and car keys. The headphone port is helpful! When running, however, I had troubles with it riding up off my hips and onto my stomach, especially towards the end of runs when the water bottles were lighter. I tried adjusting it many times, but nothing worked. It was uncomfortable and I had to keep pushing it down. Otherwise, good belt.
customer_reviews.author: Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a 5K or 10K run
customer_reviews.text: I use it trail running and don't even notice it's there. The water bottles are small but just enough for an 8 mile run. So much nicer than carrying a bottle in your hand. It does take a little practice getting the bottle out, drinking, and putting it back while on the move. The pocket on it is plenty big enough for your keys, snacks, ID, of any items you need while out there. I haven't tried it in the rain yet but it seems like it would do well.
customer_reviews.author: Rockerdude004

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that is comfortable, can carry some water, as well as my phone. This gets the job done in all areas. I have not used this in the rain yet, so I cannot speak to how water resistant it might be. However, it does not bounce when I run and you really do not feel it's even there after you get used to having it on. Keep in mind the water bottles are small (6 oz each). If you need more than 12 oz of water you may want to look elsewhere. For reference, I have an iPhone 6S and it fits fine, even with the case.
customer_reviews.author: Woz

customer_reviews.title: The belt seems very sturdy and was easily adjusted to fit my 32 inch ...
customer_reviews.text: The belt seems very sturdy and was easily adjusted to fit my 32 inch waist. The water bottles fit snugly in their slots and they stay in place when you use the attached bands that helps secure them. The only negative, and it is a very minor one is that my iPhone 7 barely fits in the front pouch. If my iPhone cover was bigger ( mine is thin and not at all bulky ) , I don't think it would fit.
customer_reviews.author: YM

customer_reviews.title: I love this belt
customer_reviews.text: I love this belt. Personally, I prefer to wear it on my lower back. It doesn't bounce and the bottles are not in the way of my arms swaying while I run. The bottles are a perfect amount of water usage. The material absorbs my sweat, and I sweat a lot. Most running belts, the sweat would go straight into the pocket and wet my phone or any items in there. My Samsung galaxy S8 fits perfect without the protective cover. Since I've got it 2wks ago, I've ran a 22 miler and a half marathon. I had no discomfort running with the URPOWER running belt.
customer_reviews.author: jackelin martinez

customer_reviews.title: Good for a 2 hour run
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm pleased with this belt. It's just enough water to carry for about a 2 hour run and fits my large cell phone just fine. The fit is good on my 32" waist. The only complaint I have is you have to cinch it pretty snug to keep it from bouncing around too much because the neoprene like material it's made of can irritate after a little while. I end up tucking in my shirt and cinching the belt down which works fine for the time I'm out on the grind.
customer_reviews.author: BS AZ

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and doesn't bounce or shift when running
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and feel of this belt. Doesnt bounce when running when the bottles are either full or empty. Holds my Galaxy Note 9 perfectly and allows for the headphone cord as well.
customer_reviews.author: Griffin R.

customer_reviews.title: New Running Belt with flasks
customer_reviews.text: I'm a distance runner and was in need of a new belt and purchased this one due to the high reviews. I honestly have to immediately knock one star off because the flasks are ridiculously tiny. Nearly half the size as my old Nathan hydration flasks. Fortunately my Nathans fit this belt fine so I will be using those and ditching the ones that came with it. Other than THAT, the belt seems really nice!! Really nice sized pocket for gear. Fits really well with no bouncing. I'll have to rethread the straps to keep them from flapping as another reviewer stated. Definitely a decent belt for the price.
customer_reviews.author: S. Manos

customer_reviews.title: Great hydration system.
customer_reviews.text: This works great. The bottles hold just enough water to keep you hydrated on longer runs without weighing you down. I like that I can put a key, a gel pouch, and my phone (in a slim case) in the pocket. Note that the pocket is not super large, but just enough to keep you from carrying too much to weigh you down! It's super easy to get the bottles off the belt while running and them re-secure them. I've run with this several times now to test it out and I have really enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Moman

customer_reviews.title: This belt doesn't fit at all! I wear a ...
customer_reviews.text: This belt doesn't fit at all! I wear a 33" waist, and the belt comes no where near me! I wish the original ad had stated it was large, or that it was available in different sizes (it isn't) - even adjusting the straps to the minimum, it still doesn't fit!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Save your health and money; wasted purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the belt with water bottles; it has a nasty chemical taste that you’re unable to get out of the water bottles. Unfortunately, this was the primary reason for the purchase, to have water during ling hikes. Regretted purchase, save your health.
customer_reviews.author: Tonda Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great belt for a great price
customer_reviews.text: This belt is great during my runs. It's adjustable for snugness. I do have to use both water bottles because they aren't very big. The compartment accommodates my iphone 6s just fine, as well as ID, a couple keys and money/ credit card. The price was great, too. I paid a lot more for a more snug fitting belt, but this does a good job, too.
customer_reviews.author: Peetsie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for runners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to wear when running a half marathon. The water bottles hold just enough to get me through my training runs (if it's very hot I sometimes have to refill one at a water fountain) without being too heavy. My iphone XS fits in the pouch with the case on it. There's still a little room for an energy gel or two as well. It's adjustable for your waist and there are loops to hold the extra straps so they aren't flapping around as you run.
customer_reviews.author: 64727d

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a similar design with water bottles a couple years ago but this one is much better. Neoprene pocket in the front that easily fits my Iphone SE along with keys and more if I needed the space. The 6 oz plastic bottles are identical to previous ones I had. I freeze water and 1 hour after running the ice melts and have really cold water to drink. The straps are very long and I trimmed about 4 inches off each end so I wouldn't have the extra material flapping. To wash the bottles I just put a drop or two of Dawn in them and shake them up and let them sit for hours and rinse them
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hogsett

customer_reviews.title: No fit for slim average height females
customer_reviews.text: I have given up on trying to use this on my long runs. After many attempts of tying and wearing it in different ways... the thing just keeps shaking itself up to my waist! It gets worse the more you carry in it. I’m a 5’6” female, 130-125 lbs, running body. Perhaps it fits better for taller folks, but not for me. I do still use the small bottles though which are great and dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: A Brielm

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!  Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: As the weather got hotter I was looking for a way to carry some water that wasn't too bothersome. I ordered this as I didn't know how I would like belting on some water bottles, but I have been impressed so far. I went on a 7.5 mile and 3.5 mile runs with it on and it worked great. I was afraid the belt would bounce with the water in it, but it hasn't. It seems like just the right amount of water without being over burdening. My pixel 3 phone fits, but it is kind of a tight fit with headphones plugged into it. Using bluetooth would make it even better. Overall I am really happy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: T_C

customer_reviews.title: Awesome !!
customer_reviews.text: The items are perfect for running especially long distance run! first it is a super light weight , secondly very convenient can bring cellphone or a key during run then the bottle are perfect for long distance run which is have a two bottle so prevent people to get dehydrated . iv'e already tried my long run which is 20 miles and its work perfectly for me. last but not least it is fit on my waist ( I have have size 29 to 30 ) if it's a little to big not a big deal I can tied twice thats it! highly recommended for long run trust me!
customer_reviews.author: chaya

customer_reviews.title: Made Well
customer_reviews.text: I have an IPhone 11 with a pelican case and this running gear holds that, one skinny scooter key, my debit card/insurance card/license, and it is a SUPER tight fit. The zipper barely keeps it closed. I refuse to take off my case I’m sure if I did it wouldn’t be such a snug fit. So any phone bigger then this or with a bulky case WILL NOT FIT. The water bottles are both 5 ounces and smell real bad when you first get them. You’ll have to wash a few times so the smell goes away. So far I think this product is good and made well. I would recommend others to purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Ferah

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I am still a beginner runner, and after doing my first 5K with a fanny pack I decided I needed something that won't bounce around on me for my next one. I've done two 5K's using this belt and it worked perfectly for me - I don't always use the water bottles but when I do they stay put and don't bounce around. The main pocket fits my iPhone 6 as well as my single house key on a keychain and any necessities from my wallet that I need (credit card, ID, some cash). I don't foresee needing to "upgrade" this any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Great for new runners
customer_reviews.text: I've been hiking like crazy for years, but decided to try trail running as a new challenge. I quickly realized that I needed a way to carry some hydration and my phone. This fine piece of equipment did the trick and did it well. It comes with two (2) 6.5oz bottles, but I found the bottle holders will easily hold Dasani 10oz waterbottles, therefore increasing my capacity. The phone pouch works great and the entire belt stays in place while running through the hills or from your foes. Because the water capacity is limited, I use this on runs of 6 miles or less. Sometimes I wear it around town because it makes me look like a player.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Theis

customer_reviews.title: Running Belt
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this running belt because I wanted to see if I could use it to hold a battery pack for a water aerobics microphone headset. The battery pack is a little bigger than the little water bottles that come with this pack but I'm able to put the battery pack in the elastic holder and secure it well enough while I teach a water aerobics class at the gym. I have not used the zippered pouch yet but it appears that the zipper is trying to separate (split) so I'm not certain about the quality of the zipper or the durability of the zipper.
customer_reviews.author: scooterjoey

customer_reviews.title: The water bottles fall out!
customer_reviews.text: The water bottles fall out. I ride a recumbent trike and I have the bottles in the front. No matter what I do they fall out so I don't use them-pretty much a waste. The only thing it is good for is holding my iPhone so I can listen to Rush while I'm riding. So I got an overpriced fanny pack, but Rush is good everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: This is a game changer!!! I love it, stays where it’s supposed to and I get compliments on it everyday. Love the water bottles you can split a bottle of water (16oz) between the two and I definitely needed that because it’s so inconvenient to hold my bottle for 6 miles. The color is beautiful as well.. it’s all around great!
customer_reviews.author: Astreja

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Practical
customer_reviews.text: I'm not used to running with any belts or other accessories so I was a bit worried this would be distracting and uncomfortable but after a couple of runs I don't even notice it anymore. The water bottles are large enough to carry a good amount of water for longer runs but small enough to not bounce all over the place and become a distraction.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Quiggle

customer_reviews.title: NOTE waist band hangs
customer_reviews.text: Running belt seems to be good quality, very sturdy, comfortable, and fits my iPhone XR & remote car key, although it feels tight inside the pocket. Do not like the fact that the straps are just hanging on the sides after adjusting the waist band so I just simply tucked them under the waist band. Didn’t originally bother to look at the product reviews and I see that various other people reported this problem (that’s on me!). I have yet to put it to use during a run.
customer_reviews.author: Andres A. Cambron

customer_reviews.title: Move on !
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of having re-usable water bottles attached to the belt and that is where the likes end! I have a 38-40” waist and the belt barely fits, it is tight and uncomfortable and actually restrictive when i walk with it. Also claims this holds an iphone 8 plus however i have to force it into the pocket which bends the plugin for the speaker; i don’t think i can fit an extra toothpick in after the phone is in!
customer_reviews.author: Dominic R

customer_reviews.title: High-quality, lightweight, sleek
customer_reviews.text: Expected this belt to be cheap and uncomfortable, but it fits very comfortably and looks high-quality. I have a Samsung Galaxy S8 with the Otterbox Defender case, and it still fits in the pocket without a struggle. If you have a larger phone, I wouldn't recommend unless you don't plan on bringing your phone with you. The water bottles are super light but would probably withstand the test of time. They fit into the holsters well and don't wiggle around. When I run, it rests on my hips and doesn't bounce, which is VERY NICE considering I've been running with a clunky fanny pack for years. I can see this belt lasting me for 5+ years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for small waistlines.
customer_reviews.text: This belt is comfortable to wear. However, it is huge. I made the belt as small as possible and it is still big on me. Then there is so much excess of the waist straps that they flop and hang when I am running. When I run, it slides all over my waist. Very annoying. The water bottles are easy to get in and out without difficulty. The pocket holds my iPhone and asthma medicine without any problems. It does not weigh me down when I run. Other than it being way too big for me, I do like the belt. I am planning to modify it so it will not slide or bounce on my waist when I run.
customer_reviews.author: christy mcanulty

customer_reviews.title: NO BOUNCE, incredible belt!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this belt! The pocket is incredibly large. I most recently went on a run and the pocket held my iPhone X, keys, and headphones with no issue. The water bottles stay in place and hold more than I thought- which is about the equivalence of a normal bottle of water. My biggest fear when purchasing was that the weight of everything would cause a bounce, however, there is NO bounce at all! I am incredibly pleased and would recommend to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Valiciti

customer_reviews.title: good belt for longer runs
customer_reviews.text: I like this belt for longer runs. the bottles are good and stay in place well. I wear it behind me as seems to mesh better that way. Couple of things i'm not a fan of is the sice of the pocket. can't really get more than a phone in there. Also the nylon belt seems to cut into my hip bones and it chafes a bit on my lower back... some solutions is a big bandaid on the lower back and i've set the proper size for my belt tightness then lined it with wristbands to provide cusion. Overall decent belt wish the holder could hold more things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for long walks
customer_reviews.text: Love this belt! Easy to adjust the waist and fits well. The water bottles are small but I feel if they were bigger it would be uncomfortable. Very simple and my phone fits perfectly inside. I wear it for walking and it’s very comfortable. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for me
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a half marathon. It was light-weight and it didn't get in my way. I was able to hold my Samsung S8 in its Otterbox case (despite the product description saying it wouldn't fit with the case) along with 3 packets of gu, some energy chews, and some tissues. It was a little bit of a tight fit with the case on, but it worked. And it kept my phone dry when it was pouring rain (which it did for more than half of the race.)
customer_reviews.author: MommaDeck

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Solution for hydration on my trail runs
customer_reviews.text: I really like my belt. I am not doing long distance races anymore but it gets really hot and humid in the south and like having hydration on hand. This is lightweight and functional. Two different options for hydrations. Hold my identification and my iPhone (I don't have a plus so not sure how that would work). It doesn't bounce around and I haven't had any issues w/ digging or chaffing. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: MAH

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and never had issues with it
customer_reviews.text: Great Product and never had issues with it. worked perfectly as i assumed and the only issue i had with this is the extra belt is hanging out which doesnt look good. so i have to remove the belt and flip it so that the extra belt goes inside rather so it does stick outside. i also felt that if they would have provided the some placeholder for the extra belt after adjustment rather than leaving hanging that would be a great for many i am sure. but overall great product and i would definitely recommend to other to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Rakesh

customer_reviews.title: Good size, poor strap idea, rigid pocket
customer_reviews.text: The overall design, shape, and size is fine; however, the pocket is so rigid that it's difficult to use for mid-run refueling. The most disappointing aspect of this running belt is that the belt itself is a web belt with NO elastic, which is abnormal for this type of product. It doesn't sit comfortably when running because of that lack of elastic. The water bottles and positioning are great, and secure while easy to access. Not a bad product for the price, but had I known the belt was rigid rather than elastic-based, I would have purchased a different product for running.
customer_reviews.author: Martha S.

customer_reviews.title: Won't fit a large phone
customer_reviews.text: I like this alot but the zip pocket is thin and narrow, so the only thing that will fit in it is my keys. NO way will my phone fit. I do wish the zipper pocket was more roomy. That was mentioned in the reviews, but now that I have it, I do wish the pocket were larger in both width and depth, so that I could fit my phone inside. (I have a google pixel 3A phone)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for Work out
customer_reviews.text: I would suggest you buy this a thousand times over! It's very nice and comfy and the water bottles are just large enough to get you through an hour long workout. There is also a nice amount of storage; I carry my ID, hand sanitizer, and lip gloss really comfortably. One can also wear the bottles to the front and back.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Not Perfect but “Better than Most”
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Holds your essentials. Best for walkers. Cons: I ignored reviews but they were all right, this is not ideal for those with a waistline under 35in. Considerable bounce *during running* leads to having to cinch it tight mid to HIGH waist just below rib cage, which leads to having to arch your back. Very limited sized water bottles so plan accordingly. Overall: Better than many alternatives but not for everyone or every situation.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: I love this belt with one exception
customer_reviews.text: I love this belt with one exception. The pocket is not large enough for a phone. I have one of the smallest phones there are these days and it does not fit. I do wish I had known about it in advance because I thought I read it would hold an I-phone 6, and mine is clearly smaller. So, now I wear this for water/snacks, and have to wear another for my phone which is not ideal...
customer_reviews.author: Kay M. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke IMMEDIATELY
customer_reviews.text: I only used this 1 time. All i put in the pocket was my phone, 1 car key, two dog poop bags, and a tiny thing of hand sanitizer...the ESSENTIALS and bare minimum for long runs for me...and immediately the zipper broke. It isn't a sturdy zipper. Everything else about it is great, but if just a couple items in the pack are enough to bust the zipper and make the thing unusable, it kinda defeats the purpose of it.
customer_reviews.author: James Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy. Fits well. Like the small bottles
customer_reviews.text: This works well. I wanted a belt with small water bottles and this is better than expected. I am.thin size 4 to 6) but am able to tighten the belt so it stays in place nicely. I dont even notice it when running. I am a "mature" running and now find having water with me on my 5 to 7 mile runs really helps me keep energy, even the last half of the run.
customer_reviews.author: Peaceful girl

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy wish I could refund!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could return. I ran my half marathon so excited to have water with me. The first 200 yards one bottle fell out and another runner picked it up and gave it to me. The next 100 yards another bottle fell out and I never saw it again. The belt was hard to adjust. The bottles were hard to open and close. It ruined my race not having enough water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to wear and easily adjustable for various waist sizes. The bottles are easy to remove and replace while running although you may need to use both hands to put it back in the holder. The only downside for me is the placement of the bottles. I tend to keep my arms fairly close to my body while I run and my hands hit the bottles sometimes. The pocket easily held my phone and key. Overall, I feel this is a good product and will be beneficial for my running.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Skip it
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a lot smaller than the picture would make you think. The picture shows multiple items in the pouch that would never all fit at one. Doesn't fit a Samsung note like it implies, it's very shallow. I honestly wouldn't have spent more than $5 on it if I saw it in a store first.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Nickerson

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend
customer_reviews.text: Had to return, took it for a test run and midway through the run I looked and realized one of the bottles was missing, had to turn back and retrace my steps to find it. Also, the belt kept bouncing all over the place which I hate having anything move on me while I am running
customer_reviews.author: Shanna

customer_reviews.title: Fits plus size runners!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to find a running belt that had so much flexibility. I am a plus size runner - I wear 20-22, depend on cut. This belt offered great flexibility and yet can still be snug for the average size runner. The water bottles were fine - difficult to drink out of while running, so I just untwisted the cap. Fit my iPhone and keys just fine!
customer_reviews.author: KStrong

customer_reviews.title: Good product — but fits poorly
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like this product — that quality is good and it allows me to be hands-free, keeping me I am far more comfortable when I go out for a longer run. My one issue is that the sizing of this belt is questionable. I am a pretty average-sized person, but this belt is too large — even on the tightest setting. I ended up having to alter mine to make it work for me. It's not necessarily the worst thing in the world, but keep this is mine if you are someone with a smaller frame.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Musolf

customer_reviews.title: Belt not easily adjustable
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at this to replace an old (and stretched out) running belt that had 2 bottles. These bottles are smaller than my previous and the straps are long. Though I am sure I can get them adjusted, there will either be a lot of extra strap hanging or I'll have to cut them. My previous one was velcro. I almost sent this back but think for the price I'll keep it and try to make it work. I do appreciate that it has a larger pocket to hold my phone, etc. So this feedback is written without trying it. If I love it, I'll amend my post.
customer_reviews.author: teejit

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great but good good.
customer_reviews.text: I am training for a half marathon and my husband bought this belt for me. My initial reaction was "this little thing". But i made it work for me and I have taken it on a handful of long trail runs. I manage to fit my phone half out, and some gells im it. Ive made it work but i think a bigger one would be nice. It seemed to have broke for me but i think i was just wearing it too tight, so dont do that.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Looks sturdy but fits uncomfortably.
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for this but it just wasn’t for me. The belt is uncomfortable, it doesn’t stretch much so it always slips. Couldn’t run with it. Also, if you are on a small side and have to adjust the straps a lot to pull it in to sit at the waist, the straps are very long and dangle as you run. I can’t use it unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price and performance
customer_reviews.text: This belt works well for me. It took me a workout to get used to and adjust it correctly, but once I did, it worked well. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars in comfort was because of the straps. They are long and the elastic only does so much to control them. I actually bunched them up, because I didn't feel like messing with them. They're a little messy looking, but it doesn't mess with the integrity of the belt's performance for me.
customer_reviews.author: Renae Nafziger

customer_reviews.title: Bounces All Over the Place and Leaky Bottles
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised this belt has such high reviews. No matter how tight I made it or where I wore it on my waist, it bounced all over the place. The bottles also leaked so that if I filled them up (full), water seeped/splashed out when I ran. I returned this product and I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: MISSING A WATER BOTTLE!!
customer_reviews.text: I like this product and think it will meet my expectations for my long runs HOWEVER it’s hard to run 10 miles with only 6 oz. of water. For a second I thought I’d just dropped it somewhere after opening the box, but having only walked the package 10 feet from the door to open it... highly unlikely.
customer_reviews.author: ardent_individual

customer_reviews.title: Small Bottle and small pocket everyhring else is ok
customer_reviews.text: Pocket needs to be slighly bigger like for example you put your cellphone and literally thats all u can fit and the bottle needs to be a little bit bigger or at least the space qhere you put the bottle so you can put another bottle perhaps a bottle of water but other than that the material looks good and is very useful i actually use it to work so i can hidrate and put some snack (bar) on the pocket the style is nice i like it
customer_reviews.author: Jose ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Good running belt to have for distant running.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent belt that came with two water bottles with the right size and not too big. Front bag can fit my iPhone 6S no problem. Each bottle is secure with an elastic band that could easily put on or take off during running. I prefer to push the belt bottles towards my back to avoid front movements which could divert my attention to the race. You have to securely tighten the belt to prevent it sliding. I would use this for long distance running only. For short runs, with your body movement that quick and frequent, it affects my race attention. All in all a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Quality running belt
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a half marathon and it did amazing. Great quality and great product
customer_reviews.author: Latoi Storr

customer_reviews.title: Lots of good, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Basically, it works great. Use it for recreational bike rides. Bottles are small, but enough for a short ride (not for a long ride or on a really hot day). What I missed is that the pocket has space for a phone and that's it. My keys don't fit and I had to remove my car key from my ring to squeeze it in. That's something people should know going in. On the whole, though, pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: ERIC PAUL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect waist pouch for running
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this waist pouch/belt. The 2 bottles hold just enough water for me for about a 6 mile run. The zipper portion snuggly holds my iPhone XS Max. The belt is pretty comfortable (I wear it above my hips, and over my shirt, it would irate if rubbing on skin while running). I'm very happy with this purchase. I've used it about 25+ times now and it looks brand new (holding up well).
customer_reviews.author: Brian F. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Easy fit running belt, easy to drink but small water reservoirs
customer_reviews.text: Running belt holds up to trail runs. I put my I phone 7 with life proof case in zipper pouch, not much room for anything else. I can go 8-10 miles on the two 175ml water bottles. But if you’re not careful putting them back into holsters they can fall out through side. It’s worth the money and it is comfortable to run long distances in.
customer_reviews.author: conrad truman

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: This belt works well and fits my cased iPhone 7 with no problem. It’s not uncomfortable and seems durable. Just wish it had an extra pocket somewhere. The only pocket fits my phone and a few bucks but if you take your phone out your always checking you don’t lose the cash. Would just be easier with a small money pocket somewhere on the bag. I’d pay an extra buck or two for that.
customer_reviews.author: SP2727

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I have ran with a fanny pack for several years and as my runs got longer I needed a way to bring water with me. This belt with the built in water bottles has been great! It fits on my waist perfectly, doesn't move around, and is just the right amount of water that I need to get me through a nice run.
customer_reviews.author: Zach K

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: For running, put it around your waist (below the ribcage). I actually found that it helped me stay in proper form for my entire run, thus decreasing any kind of back pain. If you're walking you can loosen the straps put down around your hips. Generally these kind of materials slip and slide due to friction, but this product is pretty well made. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bottle are fine, a little on the smallish side
customer_reviews.text: It's just ok for me. No elasticity at all on the belt, so you need to adjust to fit just right around your waist so it doesn't bounce around when you run. Straps flap around in that case. No room to carry any nutrition/gels. The pocket fits my Galaxy S7, ID and maybe cash, but nothing more. Wish it had an extra zipper for cards/cash. Bottle are fine, a little on the smallish side, and have bands to secure them so they don't fall out, nice reflective tabs on them. Used for up to 1/2 marathon distance, but if you're a big water drinker, this is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Very good for price point!
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with this product so far. I've used it for several long runs, and it's worked and fit well. I really wish the pocket was just a tad bigger because I'd like to be able to stash my car key, iPhone SE, and several packets of sports beans in it, but it's a tad small for this. Not a complete deal breaker as I usually have a small pocket in my capris. Overall, a very useful product and a great place to start if just getting into running longer distances.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha K.

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my marathon training. It's ok. Big enough for phone and water is easy to grab and keep running. I have to constantly adjust the waist size I just cant get it comfortable lol. I definitely like it though. I'm 5 1 and 114 for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Kaleigh Baisden

customer_reviews.title: Convenient... With a few modifications
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!! Just what I needed.... Unfortunately the pocket does not fit my Galaxy S5 Active phone because of the Otterbox Case I have (too bulky). However I've worked around that problem by using only one of the water bottles in order to place my phone in the other water bottle holder. All I have to figure out next is how to prevent the belt from spinning around my waist while walking.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M.

customer_reviews.title: but it was easy enough to rotate the belt around when I needed ...
customer_reviews.text: belt is well made, used it once for an 18 mile run, personally would prefer the bottles in the back and the pouch in the front, instead of current configuration, but it was easy enough to rotate the belt around when I needed to access the pouch without slowing down. Belt will probably fit larger waist size. I'm 34 with plenty of excess that I'll likely trim off later. Water bottle is nicely secured, doesn't leak, no bad plastic taste. All in all, great belt totally worth the money, at least for the first long run.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Great running belt
customer_reviews.text: Great running belt. Fits perfect. Light weight and great quality. It holds my Iphone so I’m hands free. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: HW

customer_reviews.title: As advertised except for the belt straps
customer_reviews.text: Really nice belt except for the fact that even with the adjustable belt straps pulled completely tight, it's still loose around my waist. During my 8-mile run the belt bounced around and moved, but never was close of falling off. I'm a 32-34" waist so for any males out there interested in this project consider another one if your waist is smaller than mine.
customer_reviews.author: MTB

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, does job
customer_reviews.text: This does everything it needs to do. I was nervous it was big the first time I wore it, but I figured out how to make it tighter. The bottles are small, but any bigger would be too big. I ran a half marathon with it in hot weather and the water lasted me through ~mile 9. It also held my energy chews, key, and iPhone comfortably. This is def worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Gabby Brauner

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: Great item. My first marathon. With cool water to drink. How amazing was your belt. Held my large phone to play my run music.
customer_reviews.author: Marion Bolden

customer_reviews.title: Even so this is a nice product for what it is intended
customer_reviews.text: It is as described. A lightweight solution for carrying water and a small pocket for cell phone and other small carry along. As others have said the water bottles can fall out even though there is a clasp to hold them in. In my case the problem when bending down and or sitting --- your body shape changes putting pressure on the water bottles and they can pop out. Even so this is a nice product for what it is intended.
customer_reviews.author: Lets go!

customer_reviews.title: Fits good with plenty of room to spare
customer_reviews.text: I always wear this when I'm running more than 6 miles. Fits good with plenty of room to spare, I've got a 36-inch waist. No issue with the water bottles leaking either, just be careful not to over-tighten the caps. The pouch holds my Galaxy S7 in an Otterbox Defender case, though it is tight.
customer_reviews.author: ClintH

customer_reviews.title: Good belt
customer_reviews.text: I really like this belt for running. It's completely adjustable so you can make it fit how you want it to. I do kind of wish the water bottles were a little bigger, but then I think it would make the belt too heavy. The pocket is a good size - I carry a galaxy s7, 2-3 gu packs, and my car key on my long runs, and everything fits just fine.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife as she is a running and doesn't like carrying a water bottle which is what let mr to buy this belt. The quality is basic to be honest I expected something a bit more sturdy. As for the bottles they felt a bit cheap. Other than that it does the job as expected
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a must have for active runners
customer_reviews.text: I used this product during a 10 mile run competition. I worn the product with the pouch and water battles in the front for easy access. I must say product didn’t interfere with my ability to run, drink water fast, and stay in the race after I adjusted the belt size to 34” so it fit me right.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Checo

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for my half-marathons and so far I used it only once. I was skeptic in the beginning as I thought the water bottles may interrupt my hand motion, but they absolutely do not come in my way as long as I jog/run. Not much of an inconvenience even when walking. There seems to be a lining in the pouch to prevent the sweat from getting in. The feel of the belt and the quality of the bottles are good and for the price I paid, it is worth every penny. I already recommended this to my colleagues.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tadikonda

customer_reviews.title: I’ve run 6 and 8 miles in it so far and it’s been great! At first i was trying to wear it ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m training for the Chicago Marathon and Just got my belt two weeks ago. I’ve run 6 and 8 miles in it so far and it’s been great! At first i was trying to wear it around my hips and it just would stay. But when I tightened it up and wore it more around my waist, it was a lot better. I wear it with the ouch and bottles in the front. The pouch is nice and big and holds my key, phone, ID, and even a Gu pouch. Highly satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Samburg

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. This has been a game changer for my walk and runs this summer. The 2 water bottles each hold 6.5 ounces and the zip pouch is big enough for my phone and keys. This definitely has been a great purchase. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Senquenetta

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good (with some modifications)
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good for running, except that the belt wants to twist, so I used a clip to keep it from moving from side to side. Also, I wear it with the water and phone carrier facing behind me (maybe most or all people do). One more thing that bugs me is the water is warm or hot when I am ready to drink it, will have to figure out away to keep the plastic bottles insulated, shouldn't be that hard (I hope).
customer_reviews.author: Prostock7

customer_reviews.title: works for $12
customer_reviews.text: Works and fit is ok doesn't move a lot on the long trail run. Cons-Pocket is small will fit a cell phone but not much else. I tried to fir a Ruger LCP but had to leave zipper open near bottom of grip. Tip: fill bottles with boiling water before use to get rid of plastic taste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Belt loosens as you run
customer_reviews.text: The concept/functionality of the belt is great. I can fit an Otterboxed Iphone 6s and about 3 packages of sports jelly beans in the zipper pouch. The water bottles are flimsy plastic but serve their purpose. My only complaint is no matter how much I cinch the belt up, ultimately it works it's way loose and bounces around my waist while running which is super annoying. I haven't totally given up on a solution yet.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Bruce

customer_reviews.title: best investment for me!
customer_reviews.text: Running belt was very comfortable, water bottles were easy to remove while running. I was hesitant to purchase because I never used a running belt before and thought at first it might be to cumbersome and bulky. Not at all! I actually don't have to use a armband for my phone and used the zipper pocket just fine. I have a large Samsung Note 4 and the zipper pocket was large enough to fit that and my car key.
customer_reviews.author: L. Soria

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I had used a Nathans hydration belt for years. The bottle tops had started wearing out/leaking, so i figured i'd get a new belt and the price on this one couldn't be beat. I have ran 3 times in this belt, and it's a big difference comfort-wise. It's so comfortable that i hardly even know its there and feels a lot lighter than the one i was used to. I would HIGHLY recommend it. The bottles feel like they are solidly made as well. I drink a lot when I run, so i did upgrade the bottles by purchasing 10 oz bottles separate and they still fit great. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, makes my runs so much easier.
customer_reviews.text: 487 miles with this belt and I still love it! The bottles may have taken some tumbles during sprints and gotten dinged up but they still are holding well. The pouch fits my phone with a headphone in the jack and a small snack without too much shoving. Belt fits snugly and securely as I run and feels pretty weightless as I go. Great product for runners that might want water, or just a place to hold their phone as they listen to music.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Xia

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect running belt for long runs
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect running belt for long runs! I’m able to put my phone and running goos in the pocket, which is waterproof and love the water bottles included, they are just the right amount without being too heavy and even have elastic loops to secure it onto the belt.
customer_reviews.author: Joy E. Dieterle

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this belt. Light weight and great for carrying my phone. I always worried about my phone falling out of my other pack. I have an arm band carrier but it’s not appropriate for winter, so this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Ann G. King

customer_reviews.title: Great for running long distances
customer_reviews.text: This is my first running belt. It fits good (32 in waste), doesn't move or bounce when I run, and it's a light. I wish the front pouch was a little bigger....but it can hold my phone and some Gu....that's about it. It gets the job done and is a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Good For Running.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this belt. It is comfortable and fits my phone and keys well while I run. The water bottles don't leak and are easy to grab out from the holders. The water bottles are easy to open and easy to drink from as they can be squeezed.
customer_reviews.author: N. Rosebrough

customer_reviews.title: Run with Pack!!
customer_reviews.text: Great! Great! Great!, Fit and Feel Great!, The water bottles are just the right size you don't even know that are there. Keeps everything secure, and a color for everyone Nice! Great Job!!!
customer_reviews.author: Soyuz57

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. Right amount of water without being heavy or burdensome. The bottles are perfect hand size and they ride on the front edge ofhip bone just right. My MP3 player fits perfectly in the pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald M Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Solid running belt
customer_reviews.text: Love this belt. It is perfect for Texas summer heat. I love that it doesn’t bounce When you run. I also think it has solid storage capabilities (keys, cards, and phone).
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Q

product_meta.title: URPOWER Running Belt Multifunctional Zipper Pockets Water Resistant Waist Bag, with 2 Water Bottles Waist Pack for Running Hiking Cycling Climbing and for 6.1 inches Smartphones
feature_bullets: Neoprene material, lightweight. It is Made of water-proof and tear-resistant material and weighs less than 4.5oz
Zipper pocket. The pocket holds smartphones, keys, money, inhaler, and other essentials. It is compatible with IPhone 6, 5 5s 5C 4s, Samsung S5 S4 S3 and other smartphones IPhone
Dual-function. There is a hole for headphone cable in front and two pockets for water bottle on both side
Adjustable strap. Fully adjustable to accommodate your waist and can be even used as a shoulder bag.The adjustable belt comfortably fits waists from 23 inches to 53 inches.
Lifetime guarantee: we are so sure you will love this waist pack, we will give you a Lifetime Warranty for any issues

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
